item.title: Honkai: Star Rail - Abyss Of Fate Janusopolis Treasure Chest & Spirithief Locations
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Abyss Of Fate Janusopolis Chest Locations In Honkai: Star Rail
  • Abyss Of Fate Janusopolis Spirithief Locations In Honkai: Star Rail

The "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis is Trailblazers' destination during the Night Veil, Shroud the Silent Past Trailblaze Mission in Honkai: Star Rail . The area has two sets of spacetime, which are Dawn and Evernight. Use the Oronyx’s Miracle: Tome of Miracles to switch between the two space-times. To find it, look for the book icon on the map.

Like all the Honkai: Star Rail locations, the "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis has various puzzles to solve, Treasures to locate, and Nymphs to find. Locating all the missing chests and Spirithief in every area will reward Trailblazers with precious rewards like Stellar Jade that they can use to wish on the limited banners in Honkai: Star Rail .

Abyss Of Fate Janusopolis Chest Locations In Honkai: Star Rail

Treasure Chest Location #1

Teleport to Destiny’s Desolation Space Anchor and go toward the 3D room in "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis. Upon reaching the room, move north and use the Unstable Bridge to locate the first Treasure chest in Honkai: Star Rail .

Treasure Chest Location #2

Now go back to the Unstable Bridge, but this time use the Oronyx’s Prayer skill on it to fix it. Then:

  • Go toward the Tome of Miracles book.
  • Switch the Space-time from Evernight to Dawn .
  • Use the same bridge to move to the room’s southeastern corner.
  • Defeat the Formidable Foe with a well-built team in Honkai: Star Rail .

After defeating the enemy, players must go south and interact with the Miracle Orb to invert the bridge Space-time for later use.

Treasure Chest Location #3

Go back to the Miracles of Tomes location, then switch the Space-time back to Evernight . Next, players should go east and then turn south to locate another Treasure chest in "Abyss of Fate" Janusopolis.

Treasure Chest Location #4

From the previous location in Honkai: Star Rail , go back to the Miracle of Tomes, then cross the northern bridge to get the fourth chest.

Treasure Chest Location #5

Afterward, move west then turn south to find another Treasure chest, but be aware of the looming enemies.

Treasure Chest Location #6

Go beyond the door behind the previous chest and climb the stairs all the way up, then do the following:

  • Enter the Hidden Passage to reach the platform across.
  • Use the Oronyx’s Prayer skill to fix the Unstable Bridge.
  • Solve the Prophecy Tablet puzzle in Honkai: Star Rail .

Treasure Chest Location #7

Next, Trailblazers should follow these steps to collect the next Treasure chest in Abyss of Fate Janusopolis:

  • Fast travel to the Silent Shroud Space Anchor.
  • Move alongside the eastern passage.
  • Defeat the two enemies.
  • Collect the seventh Treasure chest.

Treasure Chest Location #8

Go past the doors and march south to locate the next Treasure chest in Honkai: Star Rail . The road will be blocked by multiple Blacktide-Corroded Objects. Use the Oronyx’s Prayer skill to reassemble them, but be quick with your movements since they collapse quickly.

Treasure Chest Location #9

Continue down the southern passage to locate the ninth Treasure chest in Abyss Of Fate Janusopolis. An enemy will guard it, so make sure to have a strong team to defeat it.

Treasure Chest Location #10

Solve the Prophecy Tablet puzzle in Dreamshroud Mausoleum to obtain another chest in Amphoreus. To claim the Precious chest, Trailblazers need to activate the Fragments of Recollection next to the puzzle.

Treasure Chest Location #11

If players return to the Silent Shroud Space Anchor and head west, they will find another chest behind a rock.

Treasure Chest Location #12

Return to the Silent Shroud Space Anchor, then do the following:

  • Go north.
  • Change the Janus’ Hidden Passage direction.
  • Use it to reach the small northeastern room beneath Everdream Gate.
  • Collect the chest inside.

Treasure Chest Location #13

The thirteenth Treasure chest is west of Everdream Gate Space Anchor.

Treasure Chest Location #14

From the previous location in Honkai: Star Rail , move west and descend the stairs to claim the next chest, but be aware of the lurking enemies.

Treasure Chest Location #15

North of the Everdream Gate Space Anchor, Trailblazers can locate the third 3D room in "Abyss Of Fate" Janusopolis. Enter it and switch the Space-time to Dawn . Next, follow these steps:

  • Move east.
  • Turn north, then fix the Unstable Bridge by pressing the Oronyx’s Prayer skill.
  • Move past it.
  • Turn around and go to the lower floor.
  • Walk down the northern passage.
  • Defeat the enemy or collect the Treasure chest at the end of it.

Treasure Chest Location #16

Switch the Space-time back to Evernight , then move toward the Tome of Miracles on the lower floor. From there, take the northern stairs, then the set of stairs on the eastern side of the door. The passage will lead players to the Treasure chest location, above the broken scale.

Treasure Chest Location #17

From the previous location, go to the middle floor northwestern corner to locate another chest in Everdream Gate 3D room.

Treasure Chest Location #18

Solve the Hand of Zagerus: Trial of Whimsy by collecting three Coins of Whimsy to obtain the eighteenth Treasure chest. The Hand of Zagerus can only be used during the Dawn Space-time .

Treasure Chest Location #19

Use the Floating Platform in Honkai: Star Rail to reach the upper floor, then move the Hand of Zagreus to create a crossing bridge toward the northwestern platform. Enter the room to the east to collect a Precious chest, but be aware the room has three enemies lurking inside.

Treasure Chest Location #20

Move west to collect the next chest.

Treasure Chest Location #21-22

Solve the Prophecy puzzle on the third floor northeastern corner to obtain the next chest. To do so, do the following:

  • Solve the Prophecy puzzle on the third floor northeastern corner.
  • Solve the Prophecy Tablet puzzle on the third floor southwestern side to spawn the triangle shape.
  • Use the Hand of Zagreus to put the triangle on the scale’s left platform.
  • Interact with the Golden Short Spear by the Janus’ Hidden Passage.
  • Follow the spear by using the Passage next to it.
  • Use the Floating Platform to go to the middle floor.
  • Stand on the scale’s right platform.
  • Move north to collect both the spear and the Treasure chest inside.

The spear will spawn a Basic Treasure chest for players to collect.

Treasure Chest Location #23

Use the Tome of Miracles on the third floor to switch the Space-time to Evernight , then move west to collect the twenty-third chest.

Treasure Chest Location #24

From the previous location in Honkai: Star Rail , go east to use the Janus’ Hidden Passage to reach the platform across and claim the next Treasure chest.

Treasure Chest Location #25

Go back to the Janus’ Hidden Passage and switch it to another direction. Use it to jump to the middle-level eastern platform, then get the Precious chest there.

Treasure Chest Location #26

Fast travel to Theophany Chamber Space Anchor and collect the Treasure chest east of it.

Treasure Chest Location #27

Teleport to Everdream Gate Space Anchor and take the western stairs to reach the Golden Short Spear puzzle. Interact with it, fix it, follow it to the upper floor, then to the eastern lower room.

Treasure Chest Location #28-32

Solve the five Golden Scapegoat puzzles across the "Abyss Of Fate" Janusopolis to locate the final five Treasure chests in Honkai: Star Rail .

The puzzles will also reward Trailblazers with the Golden Remains trophy.

Abyss Of Fate Janusopolis Spirithief Locations In Honkai: Star Rail

Spirithief Location #1

The first Treasure Spirithief can be found inside Precious Treasure 11. To catch it, players have to use the Oronyx’s Prayer skill to backtrack the Spirithief escaping route. Release the skill when the arrow hits the highlighted parts, then immediately click and hold to catch it. Once it is caught, players can either choose the appropriate dialogue to convince it to give the Treasure chest or battle it with a strong Honkai: Star Rail team.

Spirithief Location #2

The next Spirithief is inside Precious Treasure 9. Do the same as the previous chest, then interact with it to convince it to give the chest or battle it.

item.title: Wuthering Waves: Firecracker Jewelweed Locations
item.description:
Firecracker Jewelweed is an essential material for ascending characters from the Rinascita region, such as Roccia in Wuthering Waves . Fortunately, like other ascension plants from this area, locating them is quite straightforward thanks to the collection spots function. The plants are conveniently grouped into clusters, with the locations being close to one another.

These plants are easy to spot due to their large pink blossoms, which stand out vividly in darker surroundings, creating a strong contrast. They are always found at ground level, so players won’t need to climb to gather them.

All Firecracker Jewelweed Collection Spots In Wuthering Waves

To view the collection spots for Firecracker Jewelweed, players can navigate to the item under Resources tab in the Backpack or through the Character Ascension menu - if players still have access to a character (such as Roccia) that requires it. By selecting the Collection Spots option, the nearest cluster will automatically be marked on the map. Once a collection spot is depleted, the system will mark the next closest location until all available spots have been gathered.

There are a total of five collection spots for Firecracker Jewelweed, located in Hallowed Reach (Requiem Ravine) and Nimbus Sanctum . As shown in the video above, players can begin from any of these spots and proceed through the route with minimal teleporting. In a single run, players can collect approximately 53 Firecracker Jewelweeds in around 5 minutes. Some of the locations have enemies nearby, but they can be ignored for the most part, as long as players are fast enough and are able to dodge.

Players can purchase additional Firecracker Jewelweed from Rosemary's Apothecary in Ragunna City , conveniently located near the Resonance Beacon. The weekly limit for this item is capped at 15, with each unit priced at 3000 Shell Credits. Combining a full collection run with a purchase trip allows players to gather enough materials to fully ascend a character, as each character requires only 60 Firecracker Jewelweeds to reach max level.

item.title: Fisch: How To Complete Atlantean Storm Bestiary
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Complete Atlantean Storm Bestiary In Fisch
    • Atlantean Storm Location
    • All Atlantean Storm Fish
    • Tips To Catch All The Atlantean Storm Bestiary Fish

With the new update in Roblox 's Fisch , players get some fun new content to enjoy, including the Atlantean Storm Bestiary . This new bestiary is packed full of cool fish of various rarities, like Uncommon, Unusual, Rarer, Legendary, and Mythical.

By catching all these beautiful fish, players will be able to win lucrative rewards, such as in-game cash, EXP, an exclusive badge, and more. But figuring out each fish's favorite bait and how to make them spawn can be a bit tricky. As such, here's a rundown on what you need to know to complete the Atlantean Storm Bestiary in Fisch .

How To Complete Atlantean Storm Bestiary In Fisch

In Fisch , players first hear about the Atlantean Storm Bestiary from an NPC pirate in the Grand Reef. Talking to him kicks off the Captain Neptune Quest, where your goal is to unlock all the fish in the bestiary and claim the rewards. But before you start gearing up to reel in, it’s important to know where these fish are located and how to reach them.

Atlantean Storm Location

To complete the Atlantean Storm Bestiary in Fisch , you’ll need to fish in the mysterious whirlpools known as Atlantean Storms that appear in the ocean. To find them, start by sailing straight west from Moosewood until you reach the Grand Reef . In this area, you’ll come across several Atlantean Storms , where you can cast your line and grab all the unique fish. Just keep in mind that you’ll need to use your rod into the spawning circles to get the Atlantean Storm fish; otherwise, you’ll catch the native ones instead.

All Atlantean Storm Fish

The Atlantean Storm Bestiary includes eight stunning fish , each requiring specific weather, seasons, and bait. Below is a table with the information you'll need to know if you want to reel them in.

Atlantean Storm Bestiary Fish

Rarity

Bait

Weather

Season

Time

Cyclone Mako

Rare

Fish Head

Windy

Spring

Any

Whirlpool Marlin

Unusual

Squid

Rain

Spring

Any

Vortex Barracuda

Unusual

Minnow

Clear

Summer

Any

Void Angler

Mythical

Truffle Worm

Clear

Summer

Any

Maelstorm Shark

Legendary

Truffle Worm

Foggy

Autumn

Any

Tempest Ray

Uncommon

Seaweed

Foggy

Autumn

Any

Abyss Snapper

Uncommon

Fish Head

Foggy

Autumn

Any

Typhoon Tuna

Rare

Fish Head

Rain

Winter

Any

Tips To Catch All The Atlantean Storm Bestiary Fish

Here are some tips to help you snag all the new Atlantean Storm Bestiary fish in Fisch :

  • Changing seasons takes real-time hours, so focus on catching fish that match the current season . For instance, two fish appear in spring and summer, three during autumn, and one in winter. Focus on the fish that match the season you're in.
  • Make sure your inventory is stocked with all the necessary bait . Seaweed, Squit, and Minnow are easy to grab from Bait Crates, but Truffle Worms are a bit harder to snag. To get Truffle Worm in Fisch , you’ll need to unlock Coral Geodes, Volcanic Geodes, or Treasure Chests.
  • Weather plays a big role in catching these fish, so use totems to control it. For example, the Tempest Totem creates rain, the Smokescreen Totem adds fog, and the Windset Totem makes it windy. Players can even use the Aurora Totem to increase their luck.
  • Finally, it’s possible to catch Uncommon, Unusual, and even Rare fish without meeting all the conditions for seasons, weather, and bait. However, if you’re aiming for Legendary or Mythic fish, you’ll need to check every box. Improving your luck stats is also a good idea, which you can do by increasing Server Luck or grabbing a boost from Merlin.

item.title: 10 Best Sci-Fi Isometric RPGs, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Isometric RPGs offer diverse settings beyond medieval fantasy, including sci-fi and post-apocalyptic themes.
  • Games like Gamedec and Wasteland 3 focus on deep narratives, moral choices, and immersive experiences.
  • Titles like Atom RPG and UnderRail provide unique stories, complex dialogues, and tactical combat mechanics.

Isometric RPGs are known for their strong connection to medieval fantasy, often inspired by tabletop RPG settings. Titles like Baldur's Gate 3 demonstrate the richness of stories and exploration in detailed worlds, where choices directly impact the unfolding of the narrative and player immersion, potentially leading the story to a completely different place based on some decisions made.

Although medieval fantasy is predominant, there are also options set in distinct settings to reach another group of players. For example, the best sci-fi isometric RPGs are those that explore futuristic societies, technological issues, and ethical dilemmas. These approaches diversify the genre and offer immersive and unique experiences for fans seeking something beyond the epic medieval.

10 Gamedec

A Cyberpunk RPG Based On Decisions

For players seeking an experience similar to Disco Elysium , Gamedec is set in a futuristic Warsaw, where virtual reality dominates daily life, creating a rich and innovative cyberpunk setting. The player assumes the role of a detective specialized in solving digital crimes, offering a unique approach for lovers of mature and reflective narratives.

Focusing on moral choices and complex dialogues, Gamedec explores issues like ethics and identity, providing intellectual experiences. These features place it among the best science fiction games and appeal to those seeking narrative freedom. Without relying on traditional combat, it allows multiple ways to solve cases and explore its immersive cyberpunk world.

9 Atom RPG

An Isometric RPG Reimagining The USSR After A Nuclear Apocalypse

Heavily inspired by Fallout , Atom RPG is an isometric game that transports players to a USSR devastated by a nuclear apocalypse. The adventure explores a setting filled with references to Soviet society, offering a unique view of this post-apocalyptic scenario. It's an ideal experience for those who want to see Fallout -style themes adapted to a context outside the United States.

Atom RPG offers great freedom for players to customize characters in this setting, encouraging creativity both in making different builds for turn-based combat and surviving in this new Soviet society, as well as solving various missions. The game also places significant weight on choices made during the story, as some can lead to various consequences.

8 UnderRail

A Deep Post-Apocalyptic Isometric RPG

UnderRail transports players to a distant future, where Earth's surface has become uninhabitable, forcing humanity to live in a vast system of underground metros. This premise creates an immersive world, full of mysteries and challenges, perfect for those seeking a best sci-fi isometric RPG with strong influences from classics like Fallout .

The turn-based tactical combat system is one of UnderRail 's main highlights, allowing complete character customization and offering strategic challenges. Exploring over 450 areas, interacting with factions, and a robust crafting system make the experience deep and rewarding, pleasing fans of the genre.

7 Encased

Another Great Isometric RPG With Retrofuturistic Setting

  • Developer : Dark Crystal Games
  • Platforms : PC
  • Release : September 7, 2021
  • Genre: RPG

Encased is an isometric sci-fi RPG inspired by Fallout , one of the biggest references in the genre. However, it stands out by presenting an alternative version of the 1970s in a dystopian setting with dark humor. This environment captivates fans who appreciate intriguing mysteries and dense atmospheres, creating a unique and engaging experience.

In addition to the setting, Encased also shares gameplay similarities with early Fallout games, including turn-based combat. However, its greatest strength lies in its well-crafted narrative, developing mysteries and stories throughout the game. The plot maintains a carefully balanced pace, immersing players in a deep journey rich in details, ideal for those who value impactful stories and interesting characters.

6 Torment: Tides Of Numenera

RPG With Strong Inspirations From Planescape: Torment

In a classic science fiction story, Torment: Tides of Numenera is an isometric RPG set on Earth, but a billion years in the future, where various civilizations have risen and fallen, leaving behind numerous technological artifacts. Thus, society lives in a technology level similar to the Middle Ages.

Overall, Torment: Tides of Numenera follows the inspirations from Planescape: Torment , offering players a philosophical story with a strong focus on dialogue, where it is even possible to completely avoid combat against enemies. The sci-fi setting of the game is one of its main strengths, fitting well with the tone of the narrative.

5 Colony Ship

Hardcore Isometric RPG For Sci-Fi Fans

  • Developer : Iron Tower Studio
  • Platforms : PC
  • Release : November 9, 2023
  • Genre: RPG

Colony Ship explores space travel themes, with the protagonist and other NPCs being sent to colonize Proxima Centauri. However, due to the time it takes to reach the destination, the passengers of this journey will likely live and die aboard the ship. Thus, players are confronted with this reality, where inhabitants seek only to survive, no matter the cost.

The game, heavily based on a sci-fi setting, is an extremely challenging isometric RPG, especially for new players, as it introduces several truly difficult choices and punishing combat. This hardcore gameplay competently emulates the challenges of trying to survive in this hostile environment, where trust is impossible.

4 Shadowrun: Dragonfall

A Cyberpunk RPG With A Touch Of Traditional Fantasy

What makes the Shadowrun setting so special is the return of magic to humanity, awakening dormant genes that transform people into typical medieval fantasy races, such as elves, dwarves, and trolls. In Shadowrun: Dragonfall , one of the best sci-fi isometric RPGs, players need to adapt to a society that blends magic and high technology.

The franchise brilliantly uses these new races to address issues like discrimination and social inequalities. These themes combine with many other classic cyberpunk elements, such as the dominance of megacorporations, while players face a conspiracy aiming to resurrect a powerful dragon. A unique and must-play experience for genre fans.

3 Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader

An RPG Where Fantasy Meets Science Fiction

After working on games focused on adapting Pathfinder to video games, Owlcat invested in creating another isometric RPG based on the popular Warhammer 40k franchise, taking players on a journey in the Koronus Expanse. As the Lord Captain, players need to explore this region full of dangers and simultaneously opportunities to prosper.

The game does a very competent job translating franchise elements to the first CRPG of Warhammer , something that took a long time to happen, given the series' popularity. Rogue Trader also features an exotic team of companions and incredible settings, mixing fantasy elements with the sci-fi setting, creating an epic adventure in this isometric RPG.

2 Wasteland 3

A Modern Classic Among Isometric Sci-Fi RPGs

In the depths of a world devastated by nuclear war, the struggle for survival takes unpredictable forms. Wasteland 3 is one of the most notable and one of the best modern sci-fi isometric RPGs, offering an interactive post-apocalyptic narrative. The game takes players to a frozen Colorado, filled with retrofuturistic technology, advanced AI, and genetic experiments that highlight its science fiction essence.

Inspired by classic works like Mad Max and Fallout , Wasteland 3 combines sci-fi themes with deep moral decisions and social dilemmas. The cold and desolate setting emphasizes technological advancements mixed with the collapse of human society, highlighting everything from decaying robots to the resurgence of old-world doctrines for survival in a chaos-transformed world.

1 Fallout 2

This Isometric RPG Is One Of The Greatest Classics In Science Fiction

Fallout 2 is undoubtedly one of the best science fiction games ever produced, transcending even the limits of isometric RPGs. In this title, developers skillfully blend elements like futuristic themes, speculative technology, and a post-apocalyptic narrative, resulting in an engaging story set in a retrofuturistic scenario that captivates and challenges players equally.

The game also delves into deep societal issues, often using irony and parody to highlight that humanity is primarily responsible for its own destruction. While exploring a desolate land and dealing with conflicting factions, players face challenges like robots and the constant struggle for survival in the aftermath of this catastrophe.

item.title: Wuthering Waves: Roccia Team Composition Guide
item.description:
With the addition of the Rinascita region to Wuthering Waves , players are introduced to a new roster of characters, each with unique abilities designed to enhance and redefine combat strategies. Among the first playable characters from this region is Roccia , who follows shortly after Carlotta in the character release lineup.

While Roccia is designed to take advantage of the new Echoes and Echo Sets introduced in Rinascita, her utility extends beyond future-oriented investments. She synergizes effectively with many existing characters, making her a versatile addition to teams. Roccia shines particularly in compositions that include Havoc Main DPS characters, as her Outro skill provides a significant boost to Havoc DMG and Basic ATK DMG. This makes her an invaluable support for characters reliant on consistent and high-output Havoc basic attacks.

Additionally, Roccia's combat utility is enhanced by her crowd control capabilities, as her Outro skill also pulls enemies closer. This ability allows her to complement Havoc DPS characters by grouping enemies for efficient damage output, further solidifying her role as a valuable support in team compositions. Here are some character and team synergies that can make the best use of Roccia in Wuthering Waves

Roccia + Camellya + Shorekeeper

Best Premium Team Composition

When players think of a selfish on-field DPS character with long field time, Camellya is often one of the first options that comes to mind. Known for her potent damage output, especially when she's in her enhanced state, she can be somewhat hindered by her lack of mobility during this time. This is where Roccia comes in as an exceptional support unit. With her Outro skill boosting Havoc DMG and Basic ATK DMG, Roccia is tailor-made to enhance Camellya’s abilities, allowing her to maximize her damage output while mitigating some of her mobility issues. The added crowd control provided by Roccia further complements Camellya, keeping enemies grouped and vulnerable to her attacks in a close range. Essentially, Roccia becomes a replacement for Sanhua in Camellya's premium team compositions, adding both buffs and utility that streamline her playstyle.

The last slot in this setup goes to Shorekeeper, who fills the essential role of the sustain unit. As of now, she remains as the best healer option for maintaining team health and buffs while ensuring Camellya can stay on the field for extended periods. Since Roccia’s Outro buffs and crowd control mechanics are designed to set up the next Resonator's attacks, it’s crucial for players to properly time the transitions between characters to maximize their effectiveness. In this case, players should begin their rotation with Shorekeeper , using her Resonance Liberation at the right moment to ensure that both her Outro buff and Roccia’s Outro buffs are active for as long as possible during Camellya’s field time. This strategic setup maximizes the uptime of all support abilities, providing the sustain and damage boosts necessary for Camellya to dish out her full potential.

Team Roles

  • Camellya: Main DPS
  • Roccia: Sub-DPS, buffer, crowd control
  • Shorekeeper: Support, healer, buffer

Roccia+ Havoc Rover + Baizhi

Best F2P Team Composition

For players interested in utilizing Roccia with F2P alternatives, an excellent option is to pair her with Havoc Rover, alongside a freely obtainable sustain option like Baizhi. While Spectro Rover has seen an update with a focus on Spectro Frazzle , Havoc Rover remains a respectable F2P DPS unit that can handle most content effectively, especially when built optimally. Much like Camellya, Havoc Rover tends to spend significant time on the field, making them an ideal beneficiary of Roccia's long-duration buffs. This setup enables Havoc Rover to maximize their damage potential and efficiently take advantage of Roccia’s buffs while maintaining consistent on-field presence.

Havoc Rover has some built-in self-buffs through their Resonance Chain, such as the ability to heal themselves and further increase their damage output. This means they can operate somewhat independently of a dedicated sustain unit, reducing their reliance on external healing. However, Baizhi still proves valuable for providing additional healing and buffing, particularly during moments when extra support is needed. Notably, a team composition with Baizhi is less strict in terms of rotations compared to one with Shorekeeper. Since Baizhi's buff only benefits the next character instead of the entire team, players have a bit more flexibility with their rotations and field time.

This hybrid setup allows Roccia and Havoc Rover to both shine as DPS units. While Roccia can still serve her primary role of buffing other characters with her Outro ability, focusing on Roccia’s own damage potential is also a viable approach, especially since Roccia's buffs will continue to enhance Havoc Rover’s output. By utilizing Baizhi's buffs on Roccia, and Roccia’s buffs on Havoc Rover, players can create a flexible, F2P-friendly team composition that offers both offensive and healing support, while allowing for a less rigid rotation.

Team Roles

  • Havoc Rover: Main DPS
  • Roccia: Sub-DPS, buffer, crowd control
  • Baizhi: Support, healer, buffer

Roccia + Danjin + Verina

Alternative Team Composition

Danjin is a fan-favorite 4-star unit, especially among hardcore players who enjoy a high-risk, high-reward playstyle. While Roccia's Basic ATK DMG buff isn't directly beneficial for Danjin , she can still make excellent use of her Havoc DMG buff and crowd control abilities. One of Danjin's weaknesses is that she is prone to taking significant damage, especially when dealing with multiple enemies. Roccia’s crowd control, which pulls enemies in, addresses this weakness by helping Danjin control the battlefield more effectively. In this team composition, Roccia essentially takes the place of Mortefi, who would typically assist Danjin with coordinated attacks and a Heavy ATK boosting Outro skill.

For the last slot, Shorekeeper would still be an excellent choice as a sustain option; however, for those who either plan to use her in another team or don’t have access to her, Verina makes a fantastic alternative . Verina's Outro skill provides a team-wide buff, which benefits both Roccia and Danjin simultaneously. Additionally, since Danjin can also serve as a sub-DPS, Roccia's more damage-oriented build in this composition becomes worthwhile. This setup allows Roccia to spend longer on-field time with Danjin compared to her role in the Camellya team composition, particularly when players swap from Danjin to Roccia using the Outro ability. By doing so, Roccia's Havoc DMG will also be enhanced, making her more flexible in her role as a damage dealer.

Team Roles

  • Danjin: Main DPS, Sub-DPS, buffer
  • Roccia: Sub-DPS, buffer, crowd control
  • Verina: Support, healer, buffer
